title: THE STREET LAWYER - John Grisham. Read Frank Muller {FerraBit}
description:
THE STREET LAWYER by John Grisham (1998)

Read by . . : Frank Muller
Publisher . : Book On Tape (1998) (#6044-CD)
ISBN . . . .: ISBN-10: 0736689069; ISBN-13: 9780736689069
Format . . .: MP3. 195 tracks, 400 MB
Bitrate . . : ~90 kbps (iTunes 8, VBR, mono, 44kHz)
Source . . .: 9 CDs (10.2 hours)
Genre . . . : Suspense, Fiction
Unabridged .: Of course

A violent encounter with a homeless man turns Michael, a 
rising lawyer, into an advocate for the homeless - and a thief.

Original CD tracks, labed by CD, track and chapter.
Scanned cover included.

Zip'd text & html of the book included - ESL, ebook & reference friendly.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
NOTE: There is one corrupted (unreadable) track 
 08-21 The Street Lawyer - Chapter 34.mp3

it's only 3kb. Try as I might, I could not get the track off the (clearly damaged) CD. About 3 minutes is missing, the end of Chapter 34.
Not ideal, but for those so inclined, you can read the missing bit in the included text of the book.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Thanks for sharing & caring.
Cheers, FerraBit
June 2009

______________________________________

  From back cover:

Michael was in a hurry. He was scrambling up the ladder at Drake & Sweeney, a giant D.C. firm with eight hundred lawyers. The money was good and getting better; a partnership was three years away. He was a rising star with no time to waste, no time to stop, no time to toss a few coins into the cups of panhandlers. No time for a conscience. But a violent encounter with a homeless man stopped him cold. Michael survived; his assailant did not. Who was this man? Michael did some digging, and learned that he was a mentally ill veteran who'd been in and out of shelters for many years. Then Michael dug a little deeper, and found a dirty secret, and the secret involved Drake & Sweeney. 
The first track derailed; the ladder collapsed. Michael bolted from the firm and took a top-secret file with him.
